column1: and the document is not forbidden by law to be received in evidence, any objection to its
receipt as evidence is deemed to have been waived. [See Kenakal v. Velapillai (2 NLR 80);
Muttaiya  Chetty  v.  Haramanis  Appu  (4  NLR  184);  Silva  v.  Kindersley  (18  NLR  85);
Interestingly, Deed No. 7216 (P6) was tendered in evidence by the Appellant. It was not
marked subject to proof of due  execution. At the close of his case, the  Appellant read
